intro: Brassica elongata f. subintegrifolia, commonly known as the curly leaf cabbage, is a cultivated variety of the Brassica genus. It is characterized by its tightly curled, fleshy leaves that form a compact head, similar to other members of the Brassicaceae family. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with a rosette structure that helps it conserve moisture. Its leaves are rich in nutrients and are often used in traditional cuisines for their mild, slightly sweet flavor. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal as well as its culinary versatility.
